item.title: Former Scottish First Minister Alex Salmond, who sought Scotland's independence, has died at age 69
item.description: Salmond was a central figure in Scottish politics for over three decades.

item.title: China's consumer inflation cools in September, PPI deflation deepens
item.description: China's consumer inflation rate fell in September, while producer price deflation deepened, even as Beijing rolls out more stimulus measures.

item.title: Boeing to cut 17,000 jobs as losses deepen during factory strike
item.description: Boeing said it will lay off about 10% of its workforce as its losses deepen from an ongoing factory strike.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield dips below 4.1% Friday after big jump this week
item.description: Investors assessed the latest inflation data that came in cooler than expected.

item.title: UK leader Keir Starmer is marking 100 days in office. It has been a rocky ride
item.description: Starmer's center-left Labour Party was elected by a landslide on July 4, sweeping back to power after 14 years.

item.title: Chinese finance minister hints at increasing the deficit at highly anticipated briefing
item.description: Lan Fo'an emphasized that the space for a deficit increase is "rather large," but noted such policies are still under discussion.

item.title: Stock market next week: Earnings season ramps up with more big bank results
item.description: Third-quarter numbers could determine what's next for stocks at a time when the Dow and S&P 500 are at all-time highs.

item.title: Lithuanians vote in parliamentary election with many looking for change despite a strong economy
item.description: Lithuanians voted Sunday in the first round of parliamentary elections that could lead to the center-right governing coalition being replaced.
